data.title: Ported first Nod mission to Lua
data.body: A lot less and hopefully cleaner code now.

data.title: Fixed RejectsOrders for "Move"
data.body: Required for GDI01.

data.title: Fixed NLua.Exceptions.LuaScriptException: [string "mods/common/lua/openra.lua"]:9
data.body: followup of #4371 which accidentally broke all missions.

data.title: Moved the LegacyMapImport into Utility
data.body: To make it future proof because of #4368 and #3377. Also now accessible on Mac, too. #2939 Comes with a lot of cleanup. I need this to semi-automatically convert the rest of the original Tiberian Dawn campaign.

data.title: Added RenderNameTag trait for actors
data.body:
Trait displays the player's name above the tagged actor.

Trait also truncates names that reach a maximum length (this is configurable).

Tested with shroud / fog / cloak / deaths / pixel doubling

![nametag2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/566742/2190713/41e709fc-9830-11e3-9f20-0039d2f2cafd.png) ![nametags2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/566742/2190716/48f66efe-9830-11e3-922d-788345be80da.png)

data.title: Update CHANGELOG for recent CrateSpawner changes
data.body: Closes #4634

data.title: Add support for TS terrain sprites and non-square cell sizes.
data.body:
This separates the x and y scaling factors between world and screen coordinates.  The internal simulation uses square tiles, so this introduces a forced perspective - this is used in the TS mod to reduce north-south movement speed and distort the range circles into ellipses.

This also adds initial support (basic tile data only) for Tmp(TS).

![terrain](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/1818749/5eb7c4f2-7028-11e3-8cb4-e4a21c728d79.png)

**This may break the map editor -- this needs to be tested.**

data.title: Dinosaurs cannot collect crates
D2K balance: give siege tank rotating turret again
data.body:
The siege tank had a rotating turret for a while, but now it's back to only firing straight. The argument against this behaviour is that the siege tank was useful vs. quads and raider trikes. In particular, it now won't stand a chance vs. stealth raider trikes, who will blast them to pieces before they can get a shot off. When turreted, it can quickly aim and maybe damage or kill before it's destroyed. As it stands, it probably won't be able to react fast enough to be terribly useful. 

It was intended to be a reasonable (but not impervious) counter to light vehicles. It was also intended to be able to fire and move at the same time, to make up for its low hitpoints and modest range. It also differentiates it from the longer-range rocket launcher which fires straight.

data.title: Ported first GDI mission to Lua
data.body: my first attempts with the in-game Lua scripts. Improvements include a simpler victory check and the gunboat works properly now. Fixed some NREs related to `RejectsOrders` and made it shoot and move. Also fixed `Reinforcements.Insert` with the help of @Phrohdoh.

data.title: Complete stacktrace for Lua problems
data.body:
```
NLua.Exceptions.LuaScriptException: [string "mods/common/lua/openra.lua"]:9: A .NET exception occured in user-code
```

is not helping me right now track my error. I have no idea where in my `gdi01/mission.lua` I trigger something wrong. Also `debug.log` is a huge file and not really the best place to search. I vote for an addition `lua.log`.

data.title: Changes text on visceroid icon to 'Visceroid' instead of 'Viceroid'.
data.body: Follow-up to #4373.

data.title: Initial support for unit upgrade crates
data.body:
It will crash if a crate only provides unit upgrades, and the actor does not have the `GainsUnitUpgrades:` trait. This is because the crate will provides 0 selection shares to the actor at that point (and DivideByZero happens). I think it makes more sense if it silently does nothing. That gives no useful feedback, but maybe even a _poof of smoke_ if a crate is a dud would work.

Paul mentioned doing way with the decimals for modifiers, and introducing an integer or a relational type instead:

> it could store the numerator and denominator internally, and then drop figures if it gets close to overflowing

And I wonder if it makes sense to have the GainsExperience system utilize this Upgrade class, but just level up all of them simultaneously and maintain the rank chevron?

data.title: Give details on Compiz bug
data.body:
The FAQ says "Compiz causes issues with OpenGL applications on Linux. This is a bug in Compiz itself, which they appear to have no interest in fixing. You will need to disable Compiz before running OpenRA.".

I'd like to know which Compiz bug (bug number on bug tracker) you are talking about.
If the bug still exists, players of this game could be motivated to fix it.

data.title: Reworked controls for minelayer, airstrikes etc.
data.body:
I would change minelayer's controls to the following:

When you order it with right click, it should only move when you _release_ the button (ButtonInputEvent.Up or something).

That way, you could simply drag the minefield destination while you hold the right button down, no need to hold strg anymore.

data.title: Retune production acceleration values
data.body:
It might be worth retuning some of the production acceleration values for a few queues:
- infantry & aircraft, due to how often these buildings are built and their cost
- ships, this may be fine, but the sea was usually won with whoever had more ships first

data.title: Option to toggle build radius on/off
data.body:
Opening this request on behalf of Norman - he's interested if we have the option to toggle the build radius on or off (in RA) in the game lobby.

Opinions? I can't speak for this because I've been very removed from RA balance lately.

data.title: Fix crate tooltips
Pixel art helpers by Kaito-Kid
data.body: Rebased and squashed #3981.

data.title: Game Server: handle the 'already in use' error
data.body:
The game crashed everytime when the network server
was unable to start listening on a specified port.
This happens mostly in the case when the port is
used by another application.

This commit fixes the game to catch SocketException
so that the game won't crash.

Notes:
- we expect that the SocketException means that
  we're not able to bind the port (which may not
  be true in all the cases)
- instead of showing a nice alert-dialog, we try
  to increment the port number by one and let the
  user to try it again. This is for simplicity.

The original exception follows:

```
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 1.2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1920x1080
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1920x1080
Using OpenAL sound engine
Using default device
Available mods:
        cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20131223)
        d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20131223)
        ra: Red Alert (release-20131223)
Loading mod: ra
Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: Address already in use
  at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Bind (System.Net.EndPoint local_end) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener.Start (Int32 backlog) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener.Start () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.GameRules.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Game.CreateServer (OpenRA.GameRules.ServerSettings settings) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.ServerCreationLogic.CreateAndJoin () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Widgets.ButtonWidget.<ButtonWidget>m__CE (MouseInput _) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Widgets.ButtonWidget.HandleMouseInput (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleMouseInputOuter (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleInput (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler+<OnMouseInput>c__AnonStorey24.<>m__24 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[Boolean] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1 fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnMouseInput (MouseInput input) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlInput.PumpInput (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics.PumpInput (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.EndFrame (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

data.title: fixed yaml for rushouse and snowhut
Fix visceroid health radius and name
data.body:
Visceroids are vehicle-sized (in-game at least), so their health radius should reflect that.

And yes, I'm pretty sure it should be Visceroid and not Viceroid. The majority of Westwood documents and Tiberian Suns' rules.ini clearly spell it with an 's' added before the 'c'.

data.title: Explain the world coordinate system
data.body:
What is
- WPos
- WRange
- WVec
- WRot
- WAngle

and 
- CPos
- CVec

especially how they compare to the measurements in RULES.INI for modders who are used to the Westwood engine.

Also explain how to convert legacy OpenRA rules with the command line tools from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4371

data.title: Convert remaining yaml definitions to world coordinates
data.body:
This converts the remaining pixel and other weird units used for yaml definitions to world coordinates.
Unit/aircraft/projectiles speeds are now consistent, with a speed of 41 corresponding to 1 cell / sec.
